Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, such as a forest and a pond.
The student can illustrate and label at least three different types of plants in each habitat, indicating their diversity, though labels may occasionally be incomplete.
The student can illustrate and label at least three different types of animals in each habitat, showing a variety of species, with most labels correct.
The student can make some clear comparisons by drawing patterns or examples of similarities and differences between the types of plants and animals found in the two habitats.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently show patterns of biodiversity in their drawings, occasionally missing clear examples between the two habitats.
The student might occasionally mislabel a plant or animal due to minor misunderstandings or oversights (e.g., misidentifying a water lily as simply a 'plant').
